task.title: Install the Circuit into the Guitar Body
task.shortdesc: Mount the tested circuit components into the guitar body and reconnect the pickup and output jack.

prereq.p: You need a soldering iron heated to 650-700Â°F, a screwdriver, and a successfully tested circuit.

context.p: After you confirm your circuit works correctly, install the components into the guitar body. Temporarily disconnect the pickup and output jack, mount all components, and reconnect them.

step.cmd: Desolder the pickup and output jack from the circuit.

substep.cmd: Desolder the pickup wires from the volume potentiometer.
Desolder the wires from the output jack.
substep.info: Disconnect at the output jack itself, not at the volume potentiometer.

step.cmd: Mount the components in the guitar body.

substep.cmd: Screw the pickup into its slot and route the wires into the electronics cavity.
Insert the potentiometers into their mounting holes in the electronics cavity and tighten the mounting nuts.
Slide the knob caps onto the pot knobs.
Route the output jack wires through the output jack hole in the body.

step.cmd: Reconnect the pickup and output jack.

substep.cmd: Solder the pickup wires to the volume potentiometer.
Solder the wires to the output jack.

step.info: Solder the bridge ground wire to the back of the volume potentiometer casing.

substep.cmd: Locate the bridge ground wire that runs from the bridge area into the electronics cavity.
substep.info: If your guitar does not have a bridge ground wire, you need to create one before continuing.

substep.cmd: Solder the bridge ground wire to the back of the volume potentiometer casing.

result.p: Your circuit is now installed in the guitar body with all connections properly grounded.
